intro: Connarus cuneifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf connarus, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are usually arranged alternately along the stems. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by small, woody fruits containing seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
